attributes.action: Compulsory for MPs to vote in  accordance to the vote of their constituent
attributes.additional_details: As is the recent case of Mr Dominic Gieve who despite a vote of no confidence has remained in his position, he is not alone in putting personal preference and opinion before the vote of his constituents in the matter of Brexit
attributes.background: MPs are elected representatives for their constituent and should vote in parliament accordingly recently many have put motions forward in parliament and cast votes that do not reflect the vote of their constituents you should have the right to remove your MP for not complying

rejection.details:
How an MP votes would be an individual decision for that person, and not a decision for the Government or Parliament as a whole.

You could ask your own MP to vote according to the result of referendum in your constituency. You can find out who your MP is and how to contact them here: 

https://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/mps/

You might also like to consider signing this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/236800
